intro: Ouratea roraimae, commonly known as the Roraima ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, white flowers with a faint fragrance. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
